text: well I think that the most obvious uh
way in which current is different from
other networks is that the uh the values
that are sort of written into our
constitution um are inherently uh you
know born of this Web 2.0 uh time which
we sort of have all come into where we
sort of accept uh like an interactive
Medium as sort of
standard uh whereas like CNN you know
has I report and MTV tried with MTV flux
uh which is a website current TV is
inherently a dual screen experience
where users can participate in a
multitude of ways uh in our programming
and you know that can range from
creating a short form documentary uh in
its entirety to submit to the network or
um you know you can leave web comments
and text comments uh webcam responses on
our website um for inclusion um into our
show or on air in many other ways
um we sort of launched with uh with the
goal of seeing Al Gore's mission of uh
democratizing the most powerful medium
that exists um and that that we've sort
of you know we haven't gone a day
without trying to figure out a new and
and more Innovative way to uh do
that our favorite segments to talk about
on air are the uh the viewer created
segments
um because uh well part of the reason
why we came on board was because we
submitted a film that we produced um in
college and so it's always refreshing
for us to uh to see the work of other
young filmmakers and not only that but
sometimes you get most of the time you
get a perspective that you just won't
see on traditional and traditional news
media um it's not always journalism uh
but the perspectives are just you know
just unbelievable I mean we feel very
honored to sit on the front line of the
sort of the highest value uh user
generated content production pipeline
that exists today I mean YouTube
obviously is bigger and is more
ubiquitous but you have a lot of videos
of like you know people's cats jumping
through hula hoops or you know the next
Chris Crocker out there you know it's
not it's all entertaining uh but the
user generated content that you're going
to see on current is just the production
value is just you know impeccable most
of the time and uh so we love it we get
to see stories like you know the
underground party scene in Karachi
Pakistan um nose jobs in Iran apparently
Iran is like the nose job capital of the
world um you know everything from that
to
underground uh drifting circles in
Northern California so it's just it's
really compelling and it's great for us
because you
know you know like we get to see the uh
what's on the sort of we get to keep our
finger on the pulse of what's on the
minds of uh of people our age you know
these aren't short documentaries that
come from focus groups or boardrooms and
large media conglomerates you know they
come from people just like Jason and I
so it's great those are our favorite
pieces those and then the the in-house
journalism that that Kar produces on our
Vanguard show
